description: From out- +‎ sight. Cognate with Dutch uitzicht (“view, prospect, outlook”), German Aussicht (“view, prospect, chance, outlook, perspective”), Swedish utsikt (“view, outlook, prospect”).

entries.meaning: Sight for that which is on the outside; the ability or capacity to perceive or anticipate external things; view; outlook; perspective; power of observation.
examples: When we live by outsight, we become submissive to fate.
Yet we sail toward it grasping The outsight which we know is there.

entries.meaning: (Scotland) Movable goods kept out of doors, such as animals, ploughs, carts, and other implements of husbandry.
